case_vignette: A 68-year-old woman comes to the physician because of lower back pain that began suddenly 2 weeks ago after getting up from her chair! She has hypertension, chronic bilateral knee pain, and a history of breast cancer 15 years ago that was treated with lumpectomy! Her mother has rheumatoid arthritis! Medications include hydrochlorothiazide and acetaminophen! She appears well! Her vital signs are within normal limits! Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation of the lower spine! Both knees are enlarged and swollen! Neurologic examination shows sensorineural hearing impairment of the left ear! Her gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT) is 30 U/L (N: 0–30 U/L), alkaline phosphatase (ALP) is 310 U/L, and serum calcium is 10!2 mg/dL! A spinal x-ray shows a fracture in the L4 vertebra!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Metastatic bone disease from breast cancer recurrence.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have lower back pain that started suddenly two weeks ago after I got up from my chair.
Does the pain radiate to any other part of your body, like your legs or feet?
No, the pain does not radiate to my legs or feet.
Have you experienced any loss of sensation, changes in your bowel or bladder control, or have had any fever or unexplained weight loss recently?
No, I have not experienced any of those symptoms.
Do you have any morning stiffness or pain that improves with activity?
No, I don't have morning stiffness or pain that improves with activity.
Have you had any past injuries or surgeries to your back or spine?
No, I have not had any past injuries or surgeries to my back or spine.
Do you have a history of any inflammatory illnesses or autoimmune diseases, either personally or in your family?
Yes, my mother has rheumatoid arthritis.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any joint or muscle-related conditions before?
Yes, I have chronic bilateral knee pain.
Have you experienced any recent changes in your activity level or started any new physical activities?
No, I have not experienced any changes in my activity level or started any new physical activities recently.
Final Diagnosis: Mechanical Low Back Pain
